newsitem.title: ITALY: Rinascente capital rise 81 pct subscribed.
newsitem.headline: Rinascente capital rise 81 pct subscribed.

text.p: Italian retailer Rinascente said its capital increase had ended with a subscription of 80.76 percent or 48.209 million of the 59.695 million shares on offer.

Rinascente's share capital on July 23 was equal to 292.1 billion lire, with 206.492 million ordinary shares, 37.2 million privileged shares and 48.368 savings shares, all at a nominal value of 1,000 lire.
The capital increase includes the issue of ordinary shares and savings shares linked to a 4.5 percent Mediobanca bond 1997-2000 with warrants on Rinascente shares.

The operation is aimed at financing part of a complex deal between Italy's largest quoted retailer and privately owned French retail group Auchan to pool their Italian operations to form a new force in retailing here.
